channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: This is what could happen to a child who doesn't get vaccinated
item.description: An estimated 14 million kids don't get any vaccines. They face serious threats from measles, diarrhea, pneumonia and more.

item.title: Leni Riefenstahl made movies for Hitler. A new documentary digs through her archives
item.description: Adolf Hitler commissioned filmmaker Leni Riefenstahl to make propaganda about Nazi Germany. She lived to be 101 years old and denied knowing about the...

item.title: Shooting attack at Jerusalem bus stop kills at least 5
item.description: Paramedics said at least five people were killed in a shooting attack in Jerusalem after two attackers opened fire at a bus stop at a busy intersectio...

item.title: After 6 years, Hollow Knight Silksong is here at last — and it was worth the wait
item.description: Hollow Knight was a Kickstarter-backed project that obliterated expectations. Now, after years of rumors, memes and anticipation, the three-person ind...

item.title: Attempted Trump assassination trial begins. And, South Korea to fly 300 workers home
item.description: Jury selection begins today in the trial of the man charged with attempting to assassinate Trump last year. And, South Korea plans to bring home more ...

item.title: Lisbon funicular crash victim was 'transport enthusiast'
item.description: Sixteen people died when the funicular crashed into a building in the Portuguese capital.

item.title: Palestinian gunmen kill 6 people in attack on Jerusalem bus stop
item.description: Israeli officials say two gunmen opened fire on a Jerusalem bus stop. The shooting killed six people and leaving seven others in serious condition.

item.title: Potential federal intervention poses challenges for Chicago police on the ground
item.description: As President Donald Trump signals plans to order federal intervention in Chicago, experts say the likely escalation of immigration enforcement operati...

item.title: Roberts clears way for Trump to fire FTC commissioner for now
item.description: Chief Justice John Roberts granted interim relief to the Trump administration, allowing the firing of FTC Commissioner Rebecca Slaughter.

item.title: Pastor Doug Wilson’s fringe teachings go mainstream in Trump’s Washington
What goes into getting the best personal loan offer?
item.description: Trying to slash high-rate debt and save on interest? Here's how to score the best personal loan deal.

item.title: At least 19 dead in Nepal after Gen Z protests at corruption and social media ban
item.description: Young protesters are demanding the government lift its social media ban and tackle corruption.

item.title: How four-year hunt for NZ dad on the run with his children unfolded
item.description: After a handful of chance encounters and brief sightings, the fugitive was shot dead on Monday morning.

item.title: A border-crossing moose named Emil is captivating Austria
item.description: The moose, which is not native to Austria, is believed to have come from Poland via the Czech Republic.

item.title: Six killed by Palestinian gunmen at Jerusalem bus stop
item.description: Israeli police say two gunmen were killed after the attack, which was one of the deadliest in the city in years.

item.title: China's export growth in August slowed to weakest pace since start of year
item.description: China's customs agency reports that the country's exports grew last month, but at a slower pace than in recent months.

item.title: Noem says roundup of Koreans at Hyundai plant in Georgia won’t deter investment in the US
'Tariffs are costing my business $100,000 a month'
item.description: The gulf between Trump's rhetoric and the reality on the ground is starting to show.
